001package com.technototes.library.command;
002
003import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
004
005import java.util.HashMap;
006import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
007import java.util.Map;
008import java.util.Set;
009import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
010
011import com.technototes.library.general.Periodic;
012import com.technototes.library.structure.CommandOpMode;
013import com.technototes.library.subsystem.Subsystem;
014
015/**
016 * This is a "singleton" object.
017 * <p>
018 * TODO: The "CommandScheduler.getInstance()" thing is really kinda silly. Perhaps it's how WPIlib
019 * TODO: works, but it's clunky and makes things messier for non-FRC programmers. I think I'm going
020 * TODO: yoink that method and make static methods for next year's release...
021 */
022public final class CommandScheduler {
023
024    private final Map<Command, BooleanSupplier> commandMap;
025    private final Map<Subsystem, Set<Command>> requirementMap;
026    private final Map<Subsystem, Command> defaultMap;
027
028    private final Set<Periodic> registered;
029
030    private CommandOpMode opMode;
031
032    /**
033     * Set the scheduler's opmode
034     *
035     * @param c the opmode
036     * @return the CommandScheduler (useful for chaining)
037     */
038    public CommandScheduler setOpMode(CommandOpMode c) {
039        opMode = c;
040        return this;
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * Forcefully halt the opmode
045     *
046     * @return the CommandScheduler (useful for chaining)
047     */
048    public CommandScheduler terminateOpMode() {
049        opMode.terminate();
050        return this;
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * Gets the number of seconds that the opmode has been executing
055     *
056     * @return elapsed time since opmode was started, in seconds
057     */
058    public double getOpModeRuntime() {
059        return opMode.getOpModeRuntime();
060    }
061
062    // The Singleton CommandScheduler
063    private static CommandScheduler instance;
064
065    /**
066     * Get (or create) the singleton CommandScheduler object
067     *
068     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton
069     */
070    public static synchronized CommandScheduler getInstance() {
071        if (instance == null) {
072            instance = new CommandScheduler();
073        }
074        return instance;
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Alex had a comment "be careful with this" and he's not wrong.
079     * This removes the old Singleton and creates a new one. That's pretty dangerous...
080     *
081     * @return a *new* singleton object (which makes very little sense)
082     */
083    public static synchronized CommandScheduler resetScheduler() {
084        instance = null;
085        Command.clear();
086        return getInstance();
087    }
088
089    private CommandScheduler() {
090        commandMap = new HashMap<>();
091        requirementMap = new HashMap<>();
092        defaultMap = new HashMap<>();
093        registered = new LinkedHashSet<>();
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * Schedule a command to run
098     *
099     * @param command the command to schedule
100     * @return the CommandScheduler (useful for chaining)
101     */
102    public CommandScheduler schedule(Command command) {
103        return schedule(command, () -> true);
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Schedule a command to run
108     *
109     * @param command the command to schedule
110     * @return the CommandScheduler (useful for chaining)
111     */
112    public CommandScheduler scheduleOnce(Command command) {
113        return schedule(command);
114    }
115
116    /**
117     * Schedule a command to run during a particular OpModeState
118     *
119     * @param command the command to schedule
120     * @param state   the state during which the command should be scheduled
121     * @return the CommandScheduler (useful for chaining)
122     */
123    public CommandScheduler scheduleOnceForState(Command command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState state) {
124        return scheduleForState(command, state);
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Schedule a command to be run recurringly during the 'Init' phase of an opmode.
129     * This can be used for vision, as well as running any system to help the
130     * drive team ensure that the robot is appropriately positioned on the field.
131     * This will only be run if the BooleanSupplier 'supplier' is also true!
132     *
133     * @param command  The command to run
134     * @param supplier The condition which also must be true to run the command
135     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
136     */
137    public CommandScheduler scheduleInit(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
138        return scheduleForState(command, supplier, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.INIT);
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Schedule a command to be run recurringly during the 'Init' phase of an opmode.
143     * This can be used for vision, as well as running any system to help the
144     * drive team ensure that the robot is appropriately positioned on the field.
145     *
146     * @param command The command to run
147     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
148     */
149    public CommandScheduler scheduleInit(Command command) {
150        return scheduleForState(command, () -> true, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.INIT);
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Schedules a command to be run during Run and End states, all the time.
155     * This is called "Schedule for Joystick" because joysticks don't really have a
156     * condition you might consider 'useful for triggering', so the command
157     * just runs repeatedly. This adds the requirement that the BooleanSupplier function
158     * is also true for the command to be run.
159     *
160     * @param command  The command to run repeatedly
161     * @param supplier The condition which must also be true to run the command
162     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
163     */
164    public CommandScheduler scheduleJoystick(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
165        return scheduleForState(command, supplier, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.END);
166    }
167
168    /**
169     * Schedules a command to be run during Run and End states, all the time.
170     * This is called "Schedule for Joystick" because joysticks don't really have a
171     * condition you might consider 'useful for triggering', so the command
172     * just runs repeatedly
173     *
174     * @param command The command to run repeatedly.
175     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
176     */
177    public CommandScheduler scheduleJoystick(Command command) {
178        return scheduleForState(command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN, CommandOpMode.OpModeState.END);
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Schedule a command to be run when the OpMode is one of the provided list of states and the
183     * 'supplier' boolean function is also true.
184     *
185     * @param command  The command to run
186     * @param states   The list of states to schedule the command
187     * @param supplier The function to determin in the command should be scheduled
188     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
189     */
190    public CommandScheduler scheduleForState(
191            Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier, CommandOpMode.OpModeState... states) {
192        return schedule(
193                command.cancelUpon(() -> !opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states)),
194                () -> supplier.getAsBoolean() && opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states));
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Schedule a command to be run when the OpMode is one of the provided list of states.
199     *
200     * @param command The command to run
201     * @param states  The list of states to schedule the command
202     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
203     */
204    public CommandScheduler scheduleForState(Command command, CommandOpMode.OpModeState... states) {
205        return schedule(
206                command.cancelUpon(() -> !opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states)),
207                () -> opMode.getOpModeState().isState(states));
208    }
209
210    /**
211     * Schedule the 'other' command (the second one) when the 'dependency' command has
212     * finished (but *not* been cancelled!).
213     *
214     * @param dependency The command upon which 'other' depends
215     * @param other      The command to schedule when 'dependency' has finished
216     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
217     */
218    public CommandScheduler scheduleAfterOther(Command dependency, Command other) {
219        return schedule(other, dependency::justFinishedNoCancel);
220    }
221
222    /**
223     * Schedule the 'other' command (the second one) when the 'dependency' command has
224     * just started.
225     *
226     * @param dependency The command upon which 'other' depends
227     * @param other      The command to schedule when 'dependency' has started
228     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
229     */
230    public CommandScheduler scheduleWithOther(Command dependency, Command other) {
231        return schedule(other, dependency::justStarted);
232    }
233
234    /**
235     * Schedule the 'other' command (the second one) when the 'dependency' command has
236     * finished (but *not* been cancelled!) *and* 'additionalCondition' is true.
237     *
238     * @param dependency          The command upon which 'other' depends
239     * @param other               The command to schedule when 'dependency' has finished
240     * @param additionalCondition The additional condition necessary to be true to schedule the 'other' command
241     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
242     */
243    public CommandScheduler scheduleAfterOther(Command dependency, Command other, BooleanSupplier additionalCondition) {
244        return schedule(other, () -> dependency.justFinishedNoCancel() && additionalCondition.getAsBoolean());
245    }
246
247    /**
248     * Schedule the 'other' command (the second one) when the 'dependency' command has
249     * just started *and* 'additionalCondition' is also true.
250     *
251     * @param dependency          The command upon which 'other' depends
252     * @param other               The command to schedule when 'dependency' has started
253     * @param additionalCondition The additional condition necessary to be true to schedule the 'other' command
254     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
255     */
256    public CommandScheduler scheduleWithOther(Command dependency, Command other, BooleanSupplier additionalCondition) {
257        return schedule(other, () -> dependency.justStarted() && additionalCondition.getAsBoolean());
258    }
259
260    /**
261     * Schedule the default command for a given subsystem. The default command will be run
262     * if no other command is currently running on that subsystem.
263     *
264     * @param command   The command to be run when others aren't using that subsystem
265     * @param subsystem The subsystem to run the command against when it's unused
266     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
267     */
268    public CommandScheduler scheduleDefault(Command command, Subsystem subsystem) {
269        if (command.getRequirements().contains(subsystem)) {
270            defaultMap.put(subsystem, command);
271            schedule(command, () -> getCurrent(subsystem) == command);
272        } else {
273            System.err.println("default commands must require their subsystem: "
274                    + command.getClass().toString());
275        }
276        return this;
277    }
278
279    /**
280     * Register a periodic function to be run once each schedule loop
281     *
282     * @param p The Periodic function to run
283     * @return The CommandScheduler singleton for chaining
284     */
285    public CommandScheduler register(Periodic p) {
286        registered.add(p);
287        return this;
288    }
289
290    /**
291     * Get the default command that is running on the subsystem provided
292     *
293     * @param s The subsystem in question
294     * @return the default command for the subsystem, or null if there is none
295     */
296    @Nullable public Command getDefault(Subsystem s) {
297        return opMode.getOpModeState() == CommandOpMode.OpModeState.RUN ? defaultMap.get(s) : null;
298    }
299
300    /**
301     * This gets the command currently using the subsystem provided
302     *
303     * @param s The subsystem in question.
304     * @return The Command currently using the subsystem, the default
305     * command for the subsystem, or null if there is no current
306     * command usint the subsystem, nor a default command
307     */
308    @Nullable public Command getCurrent(Subsystem s) {
309        if (requirementMap.get(s) == null) return null;
310        for (Command c : requirementMap.get(s)) {
311            if (c.isRunning()) return c;
312        }
313        return getDefault(s);
314    }
315
316    /**
317     * Register a command to be scheduled. The 'supplier' function is what triggers
318     * the schedule to begin running the command.
319     *
320     * @param command  The command to schedule
321     * @param supplier The function that returns true when the command should be run
322     * @return the CommandScheduler singleton for easy chaining
323     */
324    public CommandScheduler schedule(Command command, BooleanSupplier supplier) {
325        commandMap.put(command, supplier);
326        for (Subsystem s : command.getRequirements()) {
327            requirementMap.putIfAbsent(s, new LinkedHashSet<>());
328            requirementMap.get(s).add(command);
329            register(s);
330        }
331        return this;
332    }
333
334    /**
335     * This is invoked from inside the CommandOpMode method, during the opCode.
336     * It it the core logic of actually scheduling &amp; running the commands.
337     */
338    public void run() {
339        // For each newly scheduled command,
340        // cancel any existing command that is using the new command's subsystem requirements
341        commandMap.forEach((c1, b) -> {
342            if (c1.justStarted()) {
343                for (Subsystem s : c1.getRequirements()) {
344                    for (Command c2 : requirementMap.get(s)) {
345                        if (c1 != c2) {
346                            c2.cancel();
347                        }
348                    }
349                }
350            }
351        });
352        commandMap.forEach((c1, b) -> {
353            if (b.getAsBoolean() || c1.isRunning()) {
354                c1.run();
355            }
356        });
357        registered.forEach(Periodic::periodic);
358    }
359}
